alert.note: Alert for North Sioux; South Sioux (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 29 at 3:22PM CDT by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...Strong outflow winds from thunderstorms will impact portions of western Sioux, southern Niobrara and northeastern Goshen Counties through 300 PM MDT... At 222 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong outflow winds from thunderstorms along a line extending from 7 miles northwest of Manville to 8 miles northwest of Prairie Center to 11 miles southeast of Jay Em to near Torrington. Movement was northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Torrington, Lusk, Lingle, Harrison, Manville, Prairie Center, Jay Em, Agate Bed National Monument, Lance Creek, Van Tassell and Hwy 85 At Dry Rawhide Creek. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 800 PM MDT for the Panhandle of Nebraska.
